name: NSAlert
desc: A modal dialog or sheet attached to a document window.

items.name: layout
items.desc: Specifies that the alert must do immediate layout instead of lazily just before display.

items.name: showsHelp
items.desc: Specifies whether the alert has a help button.

items.name: runModal
items.desc: Runs the alert as an app-modal dialog and returns the constant that identifies the button clicked.

items.name: beginSheetModal
items.desc: Runs the alert modally as an alert sheet attached to a specified window.

items.name: showsSuppressionButton
items.desc: Specifies whether the alert includes a suppression checkbox, which you can employ to allow a user to opt out of seeing the alert again.

items.name: messageText
items.desc: The alert’s message text or title.

items.name: icon
items.desc: The custom icon displayed in the alert.

items.name: buttons
items.desc: The array of response buttons for the alert.

items.name: addButton
items.desc: Adds a button with a given title to the alert.

items.name: window
items.desc: The app-modal panel or document-modal sheet that corresponds to the alert.

items.name: NSAlert.Style
items.desc: The NSAlert class defines the alert styles used by the alertStyle property.

items.name: ct NSApplication.ModalResponse
items.desc: A set of button return values for modal dialogs.

items.name: ocol NSAlertDelegate
items.desc: A set of optional methods implemented by the delegate of an NSAlert object to respond to a user's request for help.
